title: USC fires coach Steve Sarkisian
text:
USC fires coach Steve Sarkisian Football coach had been put on indefinite leave day before Published 5:08 PM EDT Oct 12, 2015 Photos Stephen Dunn/Getty Images 
University of Southern California football coach was fired Monday, one day after being put on leave, The Associated Press reported. Rafael Nadal avenges U.S. Open defeat 
The coach was put on indefinite leave Sunday after school officials determined he wasn't in condition to lead practice, the AP said. Offensive coordinator Clay Helton was named interim coach. While USC hasn't been specific about Sarkisian's problems, the coach had appeared intoxicated while giving a speech during a pep rally in August, the wire service said. 
Sarkisian said the cause of his unbecoming behavior at the event was mixing pain killers and alcohol, generally downplaying any issue and directly denying he had a problem to address, Sports Direct reported.
